meanings.definition: Speak or write at length or in detail.
meanings.sent1: She would expatiate on her favorite books for hours.
meanings.sent2: He tends to expatiate on his travels whenever he gets the chance.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the student not to expatiate too much on the topic.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would expatiate into the realms of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The speaker would expatiate on the importance of education with passion.

meanings.definition: To enlarge in discourse or writing; be copious in description or discussion.
meanings.sent1: They would expatiate on the benefits of living in the countryside.
meanings.sent2: The author loved to expatiate on the historical context of his novels.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to expatiate on their plans for the summer vacation.
meanings.sent4: His words would expatiate like a river flowing endlessly.
meanings.sent5: The professor would expatiate on the complexities of the subject matter.
